message: Outside, the night air is cool, and a strong breeze. About the camp, mercenaries start to light their night fires, flames wax as the sun wanes and night falls.
snores loudly from their tent, one hand still clutching their wineskin.
steps out of his tent and holds himself upright.
looks around the camp.
sighs and heads out to the campfire to join the others.
So, who's up for a game of cards? Knackered here but never too tired to earn a coin or two, if you take my means.
Nobody else seems particularly interested in playing cards so soon after waking.
looks disappointed.
Surely we can 'ave a tiny flutter too right? Just not... playing the cards.
walks towards where the others are meeting.
grunts as he appears near Ba but stays silent otherwise.
looks around at anyone passing.
shrugs.
I can't promise I'll be focused.
And no gambling from me.
looks around and heads towards Orin's tent, stopping just outside.
Orin! Come on!
looks towards Orin's tent.
Want me to wake 'em, ser?
Give them a minute.
starts awake, nearly losing their wineskin. They fumble with it for a bit before catching it upside down. Luckily there's nothing in it.
Hope: Should we maybe be capitalising these bits? Can't remember what's in the style guide or if it's adressed

message: shouts.
Burn it!
stumbles from their tent after another minute, but walks past the rest of the group to stop in front of a shady-looking mercenary hanging out in the shadows between tents.
finally heads for the group, now with a full wineskin in hand. As they sit down, they pull the cork out with their teeth and take a large swig.
looks to Orin.
raises an eyebrow.
How goes it, my friend? Holding up well enough, if ya takes my meaning some?
shrugs.
As the party gathers around the fire night falls fast. The wind picks up, dark clouds racing across the sky, carrying campfire embers to who knows where.
remains standing tall and silent. An unmoving dark silhouette.
We should get into position soon.
I'll be getting into the tower a bit earlier.
nods.
Aye, and I'll be joining ya some.
Orin, ya sure you ok for ya role in this? Ya hittins the drink pretty hard there, so you are.
gestures with the wineskin.
I'll stay here a bit longer. Can't be seen loitering about, can I?
takes another swig.
looks slightly puzzled at Orin, but doesn't say anything and goes to walk off.
Look, Orin, ya don't need no more drink now but later, I promise ya, I'll buy you one meself - still owe ya for saving old Quinn's skin, if ya take my meaning.
just stares into the fire.
You had all better get a move on if you want this to work.
looks to the sky.
Reckons we got time some. Though don't like the smell of that air none... smells like storm to me.
grabs his things and begins wandering to the tower in question.
looks to the night air and turns round and walks towards the mess to eat some food before the night continues.
Do you think tonight is best? Something's clearly up with Orin, and I can barely pull my bow.
looks at Ba, then to Orin and then to the campsite.
grunts.
looks worried.
We only have one chance and I don't want to blow it.
Tonight, tomorrow night. Another night.
The longer the wait the more uncertain of the group we go to.
sniffs.

Ahh, by the Mother - I ain't seeing Orin being up to this, not in their state. Either I play for 'em, and ya fill me in with what I'm to say and such like, or we leave it to another day. But I'm thinking Orin'd be best at this...
I forgot about the pig men. We barely survived that last encounter.
Yes, as a reminder, this is a reference to monstrous creatures that have been stalking the party on-and-off for a while now, described as 'men with the faces of pigs.'
Pigs, rats, traitors. There's always something to kill. If you want to change something, do it.
Hope: If you want to change something, do it. ✅
Morgan: First mention of "pigs" in new edition of diaries... may want to include an explanation of what this is referring to?✅

message: If not, we move.
sighs.
Let me talk to them. Alone. Get ready just in case.
heads over and sits next to Orin in silence for a moment.
gives a low guttural noise.
grins at Biron.
Worry ya'self none laughing boy, y'all get to kill your traitors and pigs and the like sure enough, and no mistake.
ignores Quinn.
pauses a moment, then quietly speaks.
Hope: Another moment with awkward formatting to discuss✅
Would these moments where people are splitting up chat for effect on Discord be better off if we merged them into just one thing for clarity with how the formatting on the website looks?✅
Morgan: Is this enough information? Not sure I understand what's going on here or what is meant to be shown with the annotation.✅

message: How are you, Orin?
shrugs.
looks at them for a moment.
It's okay if you're not okay. I know something's up, you weren't even like this when they first dragged you to this forsaken place.
What is it to anybody what I think?
looks at Orin a little confused.
You think I could have been down in those sewers with your annoying ass without caring a little what you think?
No offence, Ba, but you don't matter. Either of us, no matter what we do, we end up here. With welts on our backs.
looks up and takes a few steps away from the others and keeps looking out over the camp.
laughs softly.
We only don't matter to them. It's up to us to decide who matters to us.
I've decided you matter, Biron and the new guys, and all.

In my world, the only things that are important are the things I decide are important. You are right.. when we die none of it matters... but in our next journey we may meet those we met here... then it might matter.
looks to the sky and smiles.
This world is shit... but it sculpts us and makes us ready for what lies after.
Hey, I'll play the game. It's enjoyable enough. But if Biron can't play nicely, how is anybody supposed to get anything out of anything?
looks back at Orin with a determination in his eye.
If I can help more people survive this world and get to the next... I will!
sighs.
Biron is a hammer... it's my fault for trying to use a hammer on glass. In the end we can only control what we do and how we act.
I won't tell you how to be... but if you need help. I am here.
falls into silence.
I never asked for any help. But if it's enthusiasm you're after, you're going to have to wait a while.
I did not offer because I think you need it. I offer because it's who I am. I won't let this world change me.
places a hand softly on their shoulder, trying to avoid possible scars and smiles before getting up and heading to the others.
A couple of nights at least.
Morgan: Maybe put these before Ba's action? So much distance between it and Orin's line before, it took me a minute to realise what it meant.

message: chuckles.
looks concerned at Ba.
How they doin'?
grunts.
Are we off now.
nods to the others.
They will be fine. It's an adjustment.
looks over their shoulder to Orin once more.
I trust them.
forces a smile.
Well that's good enough and no mistake. Or as good as we gettin' anyway.
nods at Biron.
Let's get into position, me and Quinn will have a fire arrow. For extreme emergencies. If you see it go up it's real bad.
picks up his shield and axe, and looks at Quinn.
Which one of you are with me.
Biron, if you see anything try and deal with it quietly. If it's unavoidable start singing your favourite tune, as loud as you can.
Just one second.
I've got an idea.
looks to Orin.
pauses a moment and looks at Orin.
Anyone got any sort of skill in faking a wound?
Is there anything around we could make that up with?
I am proficient with medicine?
But I don't know how to fake it.
bites his lip.
Something garish on a hand, like a fresh burn.
I can do a minor wound that looks worse.
What you thinking?
It's that or I actually stick a hand on the fire...
grins sheepishly.

Well, see in my travels, did a bit of gamblin' ere and there. Sometimes for coin, othertimes for other things that people may have... I might 'ave some ladies make up stuff, that may look like a wound if applied that way, so to speak, if ya take my meaning.
grunts.
Use a hot blade. Marks, flares up, but cauterises.
looks at Biron.
I figure if I've got a great story about how the royalists tortured me for no good reason, they might go soft.
mutters and looks to Biron.
The flogging was public wasn't it?
Morgan: Move this up to where Orin remarks that the flogging welts can't be seen?✅

message: Yes.
They can't see it.
Quinn can add some extra marks.
nods and grunts.
Needs to be seen so they'll ask about it.
Alright, Quinn... let's see what your makeup can do.
grins and starts digging through his rather unkempt looking backpack.
walks over and helps Quinn.
Make burn marks in lines on the fingers and hands... they don't burn it all at once for torture.
states very matter-of-factly.
Morgan: move this above the spoken line?

message: I love the Quinn stories. Always beg a couple of questions.
Hope: Is showing the same as ic dialogue on the web page - not sure if deliberate?

message: pulls his hand free with a small pot of some red looking paste.
Ahh, 'ere we are. Won this off a lady of ill repute so to speak. Well, shouldn't speak poorly of the lass - her repute was better than her cards, if ya take my meaning.
softly chortles.
One day I might ask you to tell me that story.
clears his throat.
Right, yeah, anyway... erm... see I'm be thinking we could apply it like, smear it some such like a wound. Bit less painful than a real wound...
stands and helps Quinn with the disguise, advising on how a real burn would look.
Make fake burns with the makeup is what I meant.
Just do it in lines as if they burned, then asked questions, then burned.
And on.
dips one filthy finger in the pot.
Don't mind if I... do ya Orin, old friend?
keeps quiet and remains as a lookout to spy anyone passing.
gives Quinn a perplexed look.
You have a strange way of talking... friend...
winks at Orin and starts to build up what starts to look like peeled red skin, stopping occasionally to survey his work and looking to Ba for confirmation.
grins.
Ya look gorgeous!
Get some dirt in there, if it helps.
And I've got some charcoal?
nods.
Perfect... ya will go to the ball!
Orin looks suitably grisly, as though they had been put to the torturer only moments before.
looks impressed.
Master Quinn, good job.
nods admiringly.
Aye, that's 'andsome that - almost convinced meself, and no mistake.
Right.
looks to the sky.
How much time have we got, yet?
Do you have a deck of cards as well? All of them had their own deck, so you might need one.
Who's got Eggard's deck? I think you stashed it away, Ba.
Needs to be the one deck.
clicks his fingers and runs to his tent to grab Eggard's deck.
returns a few moments later.
By now there is but an hour or so before midnight.
Morgan: IC line from "Ric"? Is that meant to be how it's output?✅

message: Okay... anything else we want to prepare before we get into position?
throws the deck to Orin.
shakes his head.
Not that I can be thinkin'.
catches it in one hand. They look quixotically at the wineskin in the other hand before stuffing the deck in their shirt and tying the skin to their belt.
We won't need to hide anything I assume?
nods to Biron.
You had better take position soon and start looking the part, eh?
nods.
Aye... and good luck Orin.
fishes a bottle of oil from their bag.
I don't know how useful but if you need to be out of there in a hurry you could chuck this in the fire. Small bang and flash.
stops to think a minute. Then stares at Biron.
grunts and nods. Looks at Quinn.
You, come on.
extends the bottle to Orin.
No, Biron, no need to hide... just drink and grumble... should be easy for you.
Hope: No Biron, no need to hide.. Just drink and grumble.✅

message: The rain is starting to fall more thickly, and the night sky has turned into a black blanket. Not that the dampness subdues the merry-making.
Wait.
stops.
removes their bow and quiver, holding it in open hands.
Eggard wasn't an archer.
grunts.
Aw, an actual sweet moment between Orin and Biron!!
Hope: This is appearing next to the descriptive section -> maybe move it earlier so it appears next to the part it's talking about?✅

message: Orin is still contemplating poisoning him...
Could you... hold them for me?
gestures the items toward Biron.
I'll need them nearby...
grunts and nods.
takes them.
You'll get 'em back. Be ready to catch 'em if needed.
nods.
So I've put your tokens on the map roughly where I thought you'd need them. Feel free to reposition your characters. Biron is nearby pretending to be drunk. Ba and Quinn are in the tower.
Kat: I think some of the lines form the same person could be a joined together (less confusing)?
Morgan: Not sure this chunk of annotation is posititioned correctly✅

message: Orin is definitely going to want to make sure they're not followed before they head to the card game.
They'll look for followers, then hide in the tents before coming out somewhere else with their hood up.
Did you need a Stealth roll? And how high is the tower?
No need to roll Stealth, you had plenty of time to make sure you weren't being watched or followed.
Biron is just drinking out his wine skin and ripping into big chunks of meat.
And the height of the tower?
Sorry, one sec... The towers put you 20 feet above ground. Including roof they're 30 feet high.

The party make their way to their positions in the East Camp. As the rest of the camp slumbers, things are just getting started here as the youngest (and rowdiest) members of the camp light fires, play cards, drink and swap sordid tales.

There is a vague sense of uneasiness, as if the whole camp was about to break out into a riot. Shouts are louder, the men and women here have... strange looks on their faces. The foul weather is bringing out the worst in the mercenaries.
The party get into position, restless, hearts pounding, ready for the nights' work.
sits in the dark and the rain, watching out to the east campfire.
places a quiver of arrows on the floor before him, slowly pulling one arrow after another and checking it's true.
sits, biting into a bit of meat in the bone, facing towards where Orin is, but not staring.
slurps down his wineskin.
sighs as he looks down the length of one arrow.
Wet weather like this is no good for me arrows. Almost feels wrong to put this in someone when it's all warped like. Kinda insulting if you take my meaning.
Beneath the tower the camp stretches out before you, pitch black and dotted with glowing fires.
while scoffing and slurping his food and drink. Biron also plants one of his strange metal javelins into the ground next to him.

pauses to pull the Five of Coins from their deck and slide it up a sleeve before checking the strange shortsword is loose in its scabbard. With a deep breath, they raise their hood and walk toward the card game.
As Orin approaches the square of tents Eddard warned about, they can see a few cloaked figures already here.
There is plenty of space to sit around the flickering flames, tended by a hooded man.
mutters quietly as people gather.
Yeah this rain isn't great for shooting... if I need I might get closer... if that happens stay here and cover.
glances down over the card game and mutters under his breath.
Lots of hooded folk down there, Ba, let's hope we don't hit the wrong one.
The hooded figures nod at Orin as they sit down round the fire, careful to keep their faces concealed.
A couple sit together and mutter to each other, but the rest sit apart.
nods in return.
tries to keep an eye on the one he thinks is Orin.
nods.
If we need to be shooting it's gone bad and it should be clear who's attacking who.
Hopefully this is an information gathering mission only.
Insight 6
scans the other players for nervous behaviour.
takes a chomp, ripping off a chunk of meat, eyes up the hooded figures.
Morgan: needs to be one line up✅

message: counts how many cloaked figures he sees.
also watches to their movements, to see if anyone has a distinguishing walk or particular way they hold themselves.
nods almost imperceptibly.
Aye... let's hope you are right.

Orin can clearly see the signs of impatience and fear, even though everyone is hooded. One figure taps their foot, another worries at the hem of their cloak. Orin counts five figures, not including themselves.
mimics their nervousness.
A couple more figures join the fire.
And then another figure arrives, taller than the others. This one does not appear to be nervous at all, and the rest all look up as they draw near.
This stranger strides up and sits down with a flourish of their cloak.
Shall we play?
A hoarse voice, croaky but clearly a woman's.
Around the campfire the figures draw their cards, showing the distinctive back design of a flock of birds.
nods towards the fire, nervously playing with his bow, whispering.
Here we go.
He he card pun.
Hahahaha.
Haha.
follows suit.
looks around him as well to see if any one is sat watching him, or to see if lookouts are placed anywhere.
The tall figure nods to her right, and the cloaked figure shows a card: the Prince of Flowers. Then to their right another card is shown: the Six of Sticks.
And so on, until it gets to Orin's turn.
shows the Five of Coins.
lets the 'burnt' hand linger over the card before retracting it.
nods, hesitates a moment, then moves around the circle.
So how many people are there in total, excluding Orin?
8 now.
The rotation is complete. There is a moment's silence, then...
Five of Coins! What happened to your hand?
doing their best imitation of Eggard's voice:
It's nothing. Just a gift from a sergeant.
pulls the hand back into their sleeve.
nods.
They can be cruel.
sighs.
I have news! The inquisition put six women to the flame in Witch County.
The Three Bastards are keen to show piety and are currying favour with the Church, so innocent women burn to shore up their support south of the border.
The cloaked men and women murmur in hushed and worried tones.
makes genuine distressed noises.
Do not believe the superstitious nonsense that these women folk are witches. They merely objected too loudly to their sons and daughters being sent to a pointless war.
Now, do any of you have anything for me this night?
casually nocks an arrow and looks out beyond the walls of the camp, leaning on one of tower posts, looking down on the game.
waits to see what the others do.
The Prince of Flowers speaks first, relating a shockingly detailed report of the provisions in the commissary, including weapons and armour.
The stranger seems very pleased at this. The Nine of Cups speaks about raiding the tent of the foreign fetch, the one with scars "like you asked".
But she has nothing else of importance to relate as nothing of interested was found.
Anyone else?
shakes their head.
Very well.
I see we are missing the Three of Flowers and the Nine of Swords tonight.
Five of Coins, you were sent with them.
What happened to them?
finishes his food and stretches.
Here we go, make the Deception check, no disadvantage due to your wound. DC 13.
Deception 16
Boom.
I'm sorry. We failed. I only just got away.
nods.
I heard they were sent with the bailiffs. They sacrificed their lives so that the folk might live free.
Murmurs of "For the Folk" whisper around the campfire.
For the Folk!
For the Folk!
Prince of Flowers, I need you to ingratiate yourself with Sly Ben. We need to know where he's getting his liquor from, can you do that?
nods.
The stranger gives out several missions to the hooded figures about, mostly double-checking the daily routines of senior officers and patrols.
Until she comes to Orin.
Five of Coins, I have a special task for you. Unpleasant, but it needs to be done. I need you to kill a member of the night watch. The Northerner, I'm sure you know the one.
Can you do this?
nods.
nods.
The Sparrow will hear of your courage, all of you. There's a special place for you in the Commonwealth once we win the war.
For the Folk!
The rest of the group murmur the Commonwealth motto, before starting to get up and leave.
waits for the others to go, but follows the stranger.
keeps an eye on a hooded figure to see which tent he or she heads to.
Ma'am.
watches for any coming close to the tower.
turns, looks sharply at Orin and hesitates for a moment. Still visible at the edge of the campfire, if she moves another five feet or so she'll disappear into the darkness beyond.
looks nervously around and takes a few steps toward the tower.
smiles at Orin. They see the sharp point of her chin and the thin lips of her wry smile.
Roll initiative everyone.
whispers.
Morgan: don't understand this line, but definitely shouldn't be an action?

message: Traitor!
